standard_metadata.standard_description: Recognize volume as additive. Find volumes of solid figures composed of two non-overlapping right rectangular prisms by adding the volumes of the non-overlapping parts, applying this technique to solve real world problems.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Decompose figures to find volume (unit cubes)

question.content: Unit cube:     **What is the volume of the following figure?**      cubic units  Front View | Back View :-: | :-: |

images.alt: The front view of a figure shows the top and front side. It is three blocks high. Each layer has different color blocks. The top layer has 8 green blocks: 2 rows and 4 columns. The middle layer has 14 blue blocks: 2 rows and 7 columns. The bottom layer has 14 red blocks: 2 rows and 7 columns.

The back view of the same figure shows the bottom and back side. It is three blocks high. Each layer has different colors. In the bottom layer there are 14 red blocks: 2 rows and 7 columns. The middle layer has 14 blue blocks: 2 rows and 7 columns. The top layer has 8 green blocks: 2 rows and 4 columns.
A unit cube is shown.

hints.content: We can separate the figure into $2$ rectangular prisms and find the volume of each.   [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two rectangular prisms are shown side by side. The rectangular prism on the left is made of three layers. The top layer shows 8 green blocks: 2 rows and 4 columns. The middle layer shows 8 blue blocks: 2 rows and 4 columns. The bottom layer shows 8 red blocks: 2 rows and 4 columns. The rectangular prism on the right is made up of two layers. The top layer shows 6 blue blocks: 2 row and 3 columns. The bottom layer shows 6 red blocks: 2 rows and 3 columns.

hints.content: Volume of a rectangular prism is equal to length times width times height $(V =l\times w\times h)$.    [[☃ image 1]]  $\text{Volume of prism 1}= 4 \times 2 \times3= {24} \text{ cubic units}$  [[☃ image 2]]    $\text{Volume of prism 2}= 3 \times 2 \times 2 = {12} \text{ cubic units}$

images.alt: A rectangular prism made up of unit cubes. The prism has 3 layers. Each layer has a different color. The top layer has 8 green blocks: 2 rows and 4 columns. The middle layer has 8 blue blocks: 2 rows and 4 columns. The bottom layer has 8 red blocks: 2 rows and 4 columns. The length is labeled 4, the width is labeled 2, and the height is labeled 3.

A rectangular prism made up of unit cubes. The prism has 2 layers. Each layer has a different color. The top layer has 6 blue blocks: 2 rows and 3 columns. The bottom layer has 6 red blocks: 2 rows and 3 columns. The length is labeled 3, the width is labeled 2, and the height is labeled 2.

hints.content: Now, we need to add to find the volume of the entire figure.  $\text{Volume of entire figure} = {24} + {12} = {36} \text{ cubic units}$
The volume of the figure is ${36}  \text{ cubic units}$.

question.content: Unit cube:     **What is the volume of the following figure?**      cubic units  Front View | Back View :-: | :-: 	|

images.alt: The front view of a figure shows the top and front side. It is five blocks high. Each layer has different color blocks. The fifth (top) layer has 2 purple blocks: 2 rows and 1 column. The fourth layer has 2 pink blocks: 2 rows and 1 column. The third layer has 2 green blocks: 2 rows and 1 column. The second layer has 6 blue blocks: 2 rows and 3 columns. The first (bottom) layer has 6 red blocks: 2 rows and 3 columns.

The back view of the same figure shows the bottom and back side. It is five blocks high. Each layer has different colors. In the first (bottom) layer there are 6 red blocks: 2 rows and 3 columns. The second layer has 6 blue blocks: 2 rows and 3 columns. The third layer has 2 green blocks: 2 rows and 1 column. The fourth layer has 2 pink blocks: 2 rows and 1 column. The fifth (top) layer has 2 purple blocks: 2 rows and 1 column.
A unit cube is shown.

hints.content: We can separate the figure into $2$ rectangular prisms and find the volume of each.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two rectangular prisms are shown side by side. The rectangular prism on the left is made of two layers. The top layer shows 4 blue blocks: 2 rows and 2 columns. The bottom layer shows 4 red blocks: 2 rows and 2 columns. The rectangular prism on the right is made up of five layers. The fifth (top) layer shows 2 purple blocks: 2 rows and 1 column. The fourth layer shows 2 pink blocks: 2 rows and 1 column. The third layer shows 2 green blocks: 2 rows and 1 column. The second layer shows 2 blue blocks: 2 rows and 1 column. The first (bottom) layer shows 2 red blocks: 2 rows and 1 column.

hints.content: Volume of a rectangular prism is equal to length times width times height $(V =l\times w\times h)$.  [[☃ image 1]]  $\text{Volume of prism 1}= 2 \times 2 \times2 = {8} \text{ cubic units}$  [[☃ image 2]]    $\text{Volume of prism 2}= 1 \times 2 \times 5 = {10} \text{ cubic units}$

images.alt: A rectangular prism made up of unit cubes. The prism has 2 layers. Each layer has a different color. The top layer has 4 blue blocks: 2 rows and 2 columns. The bottom layer has 4 red blocks: 2 rows and 2 columns. The length is labeled 2, the width is labeled 2, and the height is labeled 2.

A rectangular prism made up of unit cubes. The prism has 5 layers. Each layer has a different color. The fifth (top) layer has 2 purple blocks: 2 rows and 1 column.   The fourth layer has 2 pink blocks: 2 rows and 1 column. The third layer has 2 green blocks: 2 rows and 1 column. The second layer has 2 blue blocks: 2 rows and 1 column. The first (bottom) layer has 2 red blocks: 2 rows and 1 column. The length is labeled 1, the width is labeled 2, and the height is labeled 5.

hints.content: Now, we need to add to find the volume of the entire figure.  $\text{Volume of entire figure} = {8} + {10} = {18} \text{ cubic units}$
The volume of the figure is ${18}  \text{ cubic units}$.

The bottom layer has 18 red blocks: 4 rows and 3 columns, followed by additional 3 columns in the first (front) row and 3 columns in the second row.

The back view of the same figure that shows the bottom and back side. It is two blocks high. Each layer has different colors. In the bottom layer there are 12 red blocks: 4 rows and 3 columns, and additional 6 red blocks: 2 rows and 3 columns. The bottom layer shows 6 red blocks: 2 rows and 3 columns.

hints.content: Volume of a rectangular prism is equal to length times width times height $(V =l\times w\times h)$.  [[☃ image 1]]  $\text{Volume of prism 1}= 3 \times 4 \times2 = {24} \text{ cubic units}$  [[☃ image 2]]    $\text{Volume of prism 2}= 3 \times 2\times 2 = {12} \text{ cubic units}$

A rectangular prism made up of unit cubes. The prism  is made of two layers. The top layer shows 6 blue blocks: 2 rows and 3 columns. The bottom layer shows 6 red blocks: 2 rows and 3 columns. The length is labeled 3, the width is labeled 2, and the height is labeled 2.

hints.content: Now, we need to add to find the volume of the entire figure.  $\text{Volume of entire figure}  = {24} + {12} = {36} \text{ cubic units}$
The volume of the figure is ${36}  \text{ cubic units}$.

The second layer has 8 blue blocks: 3 rows and 2 columns, followed by 2 additional columns in the back row. The first (bottom) layer has 8 red blocks: 3 rows and 2 columns, followed by 2 additional columns in the back row.

The back view of the same figure shows the bottom and back side. It is four blocks high. Each layer has different colors. In the first (bottom) layer there are 4 red blocks: 1 row and 4 columns, and additional 4 red blocks: 2 rows and 2 columns. The second layer has 4 blue blocks: 1 row and 4 columns, and additional 4 blue blocks: 2 rows and 2 columns. hints.content: We can separate the figure into $2$ rectangular prisms and find the volume of each.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two rectangular prisms are shown side by side. The rectangular prism on the left has 3 layers. The top layer has 4 green blocks: 2 rows and 2 columns. The middle layer has 4 blue blocks: 2 rows and 2 columns. The bottom layer has 4 red blocks: 2 rows and 2 columns. The rectangular prism on the right has 4 layers. The fourth (top) layer has 4 pink blocks: 1 row and 4 columns. The third layer has 4 green blocks: 1 row and 4 columns. The second layer has 4 blue blocks: 1 row and 4 columns. The first (bottom) layer has 4 red blocks: 1 row and 4 columns.

hints.content: Volume of a rectangular prism is equal to length times width times height $(V =l\times w\times h)$.   [[☃ image 1]]  $\text{Volume of prism 1}= 2\times 2 \times3 = {12} \text{ cubic units}$  [[☃ image 2]]    $\text{Volume of prism 2}= 4 \times 1 \times 4 = {16} \text{ cubic units}$

images.alt: A rectangular prism made up of unit cubes. The prism has 3 layers. The top layer has 4 green blocks: 2 rows and 2 columns. The middle layer has 4 blue blocks: 2 rows and 2 columns. The bottom layer has 4 red blocks: 2 rows and 2 columns. The length is labeled 2, the width is labeled 2, and the height is labeled 3.

A rectangular prism made up of unit cubes. The prism has 4 layers. The fourth (top) layer has 4 pink blocks: 1 row and 4 columns. The third layer has 4 green blocks: 1 row and 4 columns. The second layer has 4 blue blocks: 1 row and 4 columns. The first (bottom) layer has 4 red blocks: 1 row and 4 columns. The length is labeled 4, the width is labeled 1, and the height is labeled 4.

hints.content: Now, we need to add to find the volume of the entire figure.  $\text{Volume of entire figure} = {12} + {16} = {28} \text{ cubic units}$
The volume of the figure is ${28}  \text{ cubic units}$.

question.content: Unit cube:            **What is the volume of the following figure?**      cubic units         Front View | Back View :-: | :-:   |

images.alt: The front view of a figure shows the top and front side. It is four blocks high. Each layer has different color blocks. The fourth (top) layer has 2 pink blocks: 1 row and 2 columns. The third layer has 2 green blocks: 1 row and 2  columns. The second layer has 5 blue blocks: 1 row and 5 columns. The first (bottom) layer has 5 red blocks: 1 row and 5 columns.

The back view of the same figure shows the bottom and back side. It is four blocks high. Each layer has different colors. In the first (bottom) layer there are 5 red blocks: 1 row and 5 columns. The second layer has 5 blue blocks: 1 row and 5 columns. The third layer has 2 green blocks: 1 row and 2 columns. The fourth (top) layer has 2 pink blocks: 1 row and 2 columns
A unit cube is shown.

hints.content: We can separate the figure into $2$ rectangular prisms and find the volume of each.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two rectangular prisms are shown side by side. The rectangular prism on the left is made of four layers. The fourth (top) layer has 2 pink blocks: 1 row and 2 columns. The third layer has 2 green blocks: 1 row and 2 columns. The second layer has 2 blue blocks: 1 row and 2 columns. The first (bottom) layer has 2 red blocks: 1 row and 2 columns.  The rectangular prism on the right is made up of two layers. The top layer shows 3 blue blocks: 1 row and 3 columns. The bottom layer shows 3 red blocks: 1 row and 3 columns.

hints.content: Volume of a rectangular prism is equal to length times width times height $(V =l\times w\times h)$.    [[☃ image 1]]  $\text{Volume of prism 1}= 2 \times 1 \times4 = {8} \text{ cubic units}$  [[☃ image 2]]    $\text{Volume of prism 2}= 3 \times 1\times 2 = {6} \text{ cubic units}$

images.alt: A rectangular prism made up of unit cubes. The prism  is made of four layers. The fourth (top) layer shows 2 pink blocks: 1 row and 2 columns. The third layer shows 2 green blocks: 1 row and 2 columns. The second layer shows 2 blue blocks: 1 row and 2 columns. The bottom layer shows 2 red blocks: 1 row and 2 columns. The length is labeled 2, the width is labeled 1, and the height is labeled  4.

A rectangular prism made up of unit cubes. The prism  is made of two layers. The top layer shows 3 blue blocks: 1 row and 3 columns. The bottom layer shows 3 red blocks: 1 row and 3 columns. The length is labeled 3, the width is labeled 1, and the height is labeled 2.

hints.content: Now, we need to add to find the volume of the entire figure.  $\text{Volume of entire figure} = {8} + {6} = {14} \text{ cubic units}$
The volume of the figure is ${14}  \text{ cubic units}$.
